text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['19. nimapo do kalilian a tao', '海裡來的魚人', 'The fisherman who came from the sea', '', 'si apen Kazyaz (M, 66, Iranmilek)', '王金玉，男，66，東清村', '']

S.FORM: tao rana ori a nimakalkalima-so-nakem ori am,
S.TRANSL: 那是一個寡婦
There was a widow.

S.FORM: iya rana ori am, tey-má-kdeng so nakem do ka’ang’angan na, ka-to na rana ma-ni-ni-sibo-an rana no nang ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他呢，是個非常忠於先生的人。一如往常一樣，每天都上山去工作
She was very loyal to her husband. She went everyday into the mountains to work.

S.FORM: to da a-cita o maka-pia a mi-vina-vinayo-an ori a m-oli do ili ori, a mi-bintebtek-an a ka-pi-tavaos na ori a,
S.TRANSL: 忽然，他們看見一位特別穿著傳統織衣，頭戴禮帽的人來到了村莊
Suddenly, people saw a person wearing traditional clothing with a ceremonial hat coming into the village.

W.TRANSL: 主焦-疊-穿戴整齊打扮-動綴
主焦-穿著傳統織衣-動綴

S.FORM: ma-níring sira tao am, “o, síno ya ma-ngay do vahay nio ito?” koan da o nimakalkalima-so-nakem a,
S.TRANSL: 他們對寡婦說“喔，那人是誰呀，他正走向你家呢？”
“Oh, who is that? He is walking toward your house,” they told the widow.

S.FORM: “síno ya ma-ngay do vahay nio ito a, ya akmi ka-ma-magen-an na rana ni maran a icialaw ito?”
S.TRANSL: “那個正要去你家的人是誰呀？怎麼跟已經已去世的叔叔（寡婦先夫）長得那麼像？”
“Who is that person walking toward your house? Why does he look so much like the late uncle [widow’s husband?”

S.FORM: “ey, nio i-pe-ynge-yngen so nakem an” koan na no mavakes a.
S.TRANSL: “喂，你們是在刺痛我的心嗎” 那女人說
“Hey, are you hurting my feeling? (Would you stop speaking so sarcastically against me?)” the woman said.

S.FORM: “beken, ya akmi iya rana ya mi-so-sonong no vahay nio”, to mak-owbot am, iya ori a.
S.TRANSL: “不，他真的很像他（寡婦先夫），他直走向你家哦” 。寡婦就出去看了看，真的有人
“Really, there is a person who looks like him (your late husband) walking toward your home.” The widow looked, and lo and behold He was there.

S.FORM: karaan am, to rana angay do vahay ori o mehakay ang, to rana a-kman so sang ori a.
S.TRANSL: 那男人就進了屋裡，然後就這樣
The man walked into the widow’s home. And then it was like that.

S.FORM: nona, mi na yan-an so ciring ori am, to rana maci-lolo rana ori o mavakes a.
S.TRANSL: 對了，他就對寡婦表示心意，寡婦就跟他走了
Oh, yes, and he proposed to her. The widow went with him.

S.FORM: karaan am, m-osok sira do ttaw ori am, am-ian o tatala na do pasalan ori am, om-avang rana sira,
S.TRANSL: 他們下去海邊後，船已停在港口的岸上，他們就上船了
They went toward the sea. When they got to the area where boats were tied up, they boarded one.

S.FORM: ma-láod rana sira am, to na a-cita o mehakay a mi-isis a,
S.TRANSL: 他們划離岸邊很遠的海上時，她發現男的開始長出了鱗片
When they got to a place far from the shore, she saw the man starting to grow scales.

S.FORM: ma-níring o mavakes am, “ya ka ma-kong ya?”
S.TRANSL: 女的說“你怎麼了？”
“What’s the matter with you?” the woman said.

S.FORM: ma-níring o mehakay am, “cinatao ko saon am, ya ko ma-kongo?” to na pa nazíbo-an a.
S.TRANSL: 男的說“沒什麼，這是我本來的樣子” 她當時還沒有在意
“Nothing. It’s just who I am,” the man said. She didn’t care at that time.

S.FORM: ka-to na ngaód-an sia do tey-laod, to na a-cita a mi-ipos a,
S.TRANSL: 他繼續划向大海去。接著她又發現了他的尾巴
When he rowed even farther from the shore, she saw him starting to grow a fish tail.

S.FORM: “ya ka ma-kong ya?” “ya ko ma-kong? cinatao ko saon am”.
S.TRANSL: “你到底怎麼回事？” “我沒怎樣啊，這是我本來的樣子啊”
“What is happening to you?” “Nothing is happening. It is just who I am.”

S.FORM: karaan am, to rana mi-ngóngyod a among a, mi-pani-panid a mi-ipo-ipos a, karaan am, to rana ’okso do wawa.
S.TRANSL: 後來他真的變成了魚，有了尾巴以後又長出了翅膀，然後就跳到海裡去了
Then he finally became a real fish with a tail and fins and jumped into the sea.

S.FORM: ma-níring do mavakes do ian na do wawa am, “imo rana am, to ka ngían do jia, ta panoma-en ko pa o apzapzatan ta an”.
S.TRANSL: 他跳去海裡後，對女的說“你暫時待在這裡，我先帶東西下去”
When he was in the sea, he told the woman, “Wait here for a moment for I will take our things down first.”

S.FORM: karaan am, ji rana a-teneng a mi-zi-ziak o mavakes a,
S.TRANSL: 那女的已經（嚇的）不知道該說什麼話了
The woman was so frightened that she couldn’t speak.

S.FORM: karaan am, to mi-atay o alalabngan am, “key! mo alalabngan, ta ya ko ma-niahey” koan na.
S.TRANSL: 正好有隻alalabngan經過，“alalabngan，快來救我，我好怕” 女的說
At the time an animal called alalabngan passed, and the woman said, “alalabngan, please save me! I’m so scared.”

S.FORM: “na, nohon a, mi ko pa mang-hap so vazit, ta paka-pia-en ko” ori a ka-p-avek na sia ori a,
S.TRANSL: “哦，對了！我先去拿藤子來做（籃子）” ，女的不斷的催促牠要儘快
“Okay, I have to get some rattan to make [a basket,” the woman kept on asking him (the alalabngan) to move faster.

S.FORM: “citai ta wani-an ko pa” koan na, “key! mo alalabngan, ta ya ko ma-niahey” koan na,
S.TRANSL: alalabngan說“你就等一下，我先削去藤肉” ，女的說“alalabngan，你快一點嘛，我怕死了”
“Calm down! I need to remove the inside of the rattan first,” the alalabngan said. “Quick, I am really scared,” the woman said.

S.FORM: “nohon, pareng-en ko rana”, teyka na rana pareng-en am, “ángay rana do jito” koan na am, ma-ngay rana o mavakes a.
S.TRANSL: “好啦，我編一下就好了” ，alalabngan一做好就說“上來吧” ，那女的就上去坐了
“Okay, I will be ready in a second.” When the alalabngan was finished, he said, “Get in.” The woman got in.

S.FORM: karaan am, to na rana naláp-an a, ma-ngay do pasalan,
S.TRANSL: 然後載著她就飛回岸上去了
He flew her back to the harbor.

S.FORM: “nohon, ta mi-lis ko do jia, ji ko to ngían do jia”.
S.TRANSL: “好啦！我不會離開這裡，我會一直待在這裡”
“Okay, I will stay here and not leave.”

S.FORM: mi-alalam o ráko a alalabngan am, o ráko a vato am, to na i ngap-a lalam na am, toda a-psa o votoy na am, to rana a-wakwak ori a.
S.TRANSL: 大alalabngan看見一塊大石頭，就拿來玩一玩，結果不小心砸到了自己的腹部，當場斃命
Alalabngan saw a huge rock and started to play with it, but he accidentally dropped the rock on his belly, and he died.

S.FORM: maka-pia mang-mang-may o mavakes ori a, ta ka-rilaw na o alalabngan a.
S.TRANSL: 寡婦拼命的趕做芋糕，以慰勞alalabngan的辛苦
The widow went back home to make taro cake for the alalabngan for saving her,

S.FORM: i-osok na rana o kanen na am, ta! ma-meza-mezay rana do ttaw am, lavi-an na rana ori no mavakes a.
S.TRANSL: 當她拿著芋糕食物到海邊時，發現alalabngan已經昏倒攤死在海邊了，寡婦為了牠非常傷心，就一直哭。
but when she took the food to the seashore, she found alalabngan already dead, and therefore she was very sad and kept crying.

S.FORM: ka-to da ngaód-an sia ma-ngay do awa ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他就划著船往大海上去了
They rowed out into the sea.

S.FORM: i-ptad na rana do pasalan am, ma-níring o mavakes am, “imo rana am, ji ka mi-lis do jia an, ta m-ian so vazay ko jimo an”,
S.TRANSL: 牠把她放下來以後，她對alalabngan說，“你先待在這裡不要離開哦，因為我要為你做點事
Once she was put down, the woman told the alalabngan, “Wait here for a moment, for I need to do something for you.”
